revised_title: Inquiry on the Scurvy-grass of Greenland and its Properties
tldr: The author, David Nicolson, investigates whether the Scurvy-grass of Greenland has the same properties as the one in England. He observes that the plant's volatile salt changes its nature as it approaches the sun, becoming less pungent in the warmer climate of Greenland. Nicolson also notes the remarkable change in the plant's properties when exposed to the sun's heat in London, suggesting that the saline matter in Greenland becomes more volatile over time.
